definition: happy/carefree/at one's ease/variant of 預|预[yu4]/old variant of 與|与[yu4]
abbr. for Henan province 河南 in central China

sentences.english: His father did not hesitate to support and help him.
sentences.chinese: 李父毫不犹豫支持并扶持。

sentences.english: It was my neighbor’s wife! I rushed in without hesitation.
sentences.chinese: 原来是我邻居的妻子在叫唤，我毫不犹豫的冲了过去。

sentences.english: We shouldn't boggle at this opportunity to make a profit.
sentences.chinese: 对这个赚钱的机会我们不应犹豫。

sentences.english: Between these four ways, a less sagacious man would have remained undecided.
sentences.chinese: 在这四条路中，不如他明智的人一定会犹豫不决。

sentences.english: I held back not knowing his real intention.
sentences.chinese: 我有点犹豫不定，不知道他的真正意图是什么。

sentences.english: Most viewers can empathize with the sense of hesitation and uncertainty embodied in such an image.
sentences.chinese: 大多数读者都能感受到这幅画中包含的犹豫和彷徨。

sentences.english: Otherwise, you will easily get lost or hesitate to go ahead.
sentences.chinese: 否则，你很容易就会迷失方向或者犹豫不前。
他的声音犹豫不决，吞吞吐吐。

sentences.english: As if unsure of where he is, she hesitated and looked around.
sentences.chinese: 她仿佛茫然不知声身在何处，犹豫地向四周打量。

sentences.english: But the more Tess thought of the step the more reluctant was she to take it.
sentences.chinese: 但是苔丝越是思考这个办法，她越是犹豫起来。

sentences.english: Both sides still balk at his draft document's latest wording.
sentences.chinese: 双方仍就他的文件初稿里的最新措辞犹豫不决。

sentences.english: She hesitated, and then she smiled at him.
sentences.chinese: 她犹豫了一下，然后对着儿子笑了笑。

sentences.english: She hesitated whether she would take our advice.
sentences.chinese: 她对是否接受我们的劝告犹豫不定。

sentences.english: Fang's wife drank the poison with no hesitation. The poisoned turned out to be a cup of vinegar.
sentences.chinese: 房的老婆毫不犹豫地把毒酒喝了，其实那这是一杯醋。

sentences.english: As if unsure of where she was, she hesitated and looked around.
sentences.chinese: 她仿佛茫然不知身在何处，犹犹豫豫向四周看。

sentences.english: As if he were in pain or in some torment of irresolution.
sentences.chinese: 好像他很痛苦或者是处在某种犹豫不决的折磨中。

definition: to feel embarrassed or awkward/to make things difficult (for someone)/to find things difficult (to do or manage)
to intertwine/to band together (with)/to link up (with)/twisted/tangled/confused/to be at a loss
to clench one's teeth/to grind the teeth/gnaw
to look distracted/to stare blankly/distracted/blank/(coll.) unexpectedly/rash/rashly
to consider past cause and future effect (idiom); to think over the past and future/to ponder over reasons and connection
to hesitate over what move to make (idiom); to waver/to shilly-shally
